meanings.sent1: I heard the miaowing of a cat outside my window last night.
meanings.sent2: The constant miaowing of the kitten was both cute and annoying.
meanings.sent3: The miaowing of the cat seemed to be its way of asking for more food.
meanings.sent4: The eerie miaowing in the dark alley made me feel like I was being watched.
meanings.sent5: The loud miaowing echoed through the empty street, breaking the silence.

meanings.definition: To make the sound of a cat
meanings.sent1: The stray cat miaowing at the door wanted to come inside.
meanings.sent2: She was miaowing softly to call her cat back home.
meanings.sent3: The actor miaowing on stage brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The wind miaowing through the trees sounded like a chorus of cats.
meanings.sent5: The child was miaowing playfully, pretending to be a cat.

meanings.definition: The act of vocalizing like a cat
meanings.sent1: Her miaowing during the play added a touch of humor to the scene.
meanings.sent2: The sudden miaowing in the room startled everyone.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends burst into miaowing to mimic the cat they saw.
meanings.sent4: The miaowing contest at the fair was filled with laughter and fun.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic miaowing of the choir of children sounded like a feline orchestra.
